definition: to detain as criminal/criminal detention/abbr. for 刑事拘留[xing2 shi4 ju1 liu2]
to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible

sentences.english: Manage " flagman sports " the merchant of net inn also by punishment arrest.
sentences.chinese: 经营“旗手体育”网店的店主也被刑拘。

sentences.english: The other 2 men were arrested for making and spreading rumors on the Web.
sentences.chinese: 另外2人因在网络上制造和传播谣言被刑拘。

sentences.english: Currently three Detention by the police according to law.
sentences.chinese: 目前三人已被警方依法刑拘。

definition: release from custody, subject to provision of a surety, pending investigation (PRC)
to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
to make a full confession/to plead guilty
residential surveillance, a form of noncustodial house arrest
